item.title: Casper
item.description: Casper the friendly ghost: A “correct-by-construction” blockchain consensus protocol Vlad Zamfir (Ethereum Foundation) https://twitter.com/kanzure/status/1091460316288868352 I have one announcement to make before we start the session. If you feel like after all of these talks that the thing you really need is a drink, then there’s help. Chainlink is hosting the Stanford Blockchain Conference happy hour at The Patio which is the most famous bar in Palo Alto. It doesn’t mean that much, but it’s good fun.

item.title: Sharding The Blockchain
item.description: I am going to talk about blockchain sharding. This is one of the scaling solutions that I like the most. I have done the most work on it. In case you don’t know who I am, I am a researcher mostly with the ethereum project. Basically the basics of sharding is that in non-sharding, every node does every validation. In a sharding solution, nodes hold a subset of the state, and a subset of the blockchain.
